content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

To create the `clean_column` function in Julia, you can use the following code:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    # Lowercase the string
    col_lower = lowercase(col)

    # Strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    col_strip = strip(col_lower)

    # Replace any spaces and hyphens with an underscore
    col_underscore = replace(col_strip, r"\s|-"=>"_")

    return col_underscore
end
```

This function takes a `col` argument of type `String`, performs the required clean-up operations, and returns the cleaned column name as a string.
